title: A Little / Little / A Few / Few
description: Choose: a little / little / a few / few

title: Adjectives and Prepositions Exercise 1
description: Put in the correct preposition

title: Articles with Geographical Names 1
description: Put in 'the' or -

title: Articles with Geographical Names 2
description: Put in 'the' or -

title: As and Like
description: Choose 'as' or 'like'

title: Bed / home / work / town
description: Fill the gap with 'the' or use - if you don't need an article.

title: Causatives 1
description: Change the sentences so they use the structure 'have something done' or 'get something done'.

title: Causatives 2
description: Change the sentences so that they use the structure 'have someone do something' or 'get someone to do something'. Start with 'I'.

title: Comparative Adjectives
description: Make the comparative form. If it's possible, use 'er'. If not, use 'more'.

title: Could have should have would have
description: Make the correct past modal form (use could have / would have / should have + past participle)

title: Present simple questions
description: Choose: do / does / is / are

title: Either and Neither Exercise 1
description: Put in 'of' or '-'

title: Either and Neither Exercise 2
description: Choose 'either' or 'neither'

title: Embedded Questions in Statements
description: Change the normal question into an embedded question. Start with 'I don't know'.

title: Unaccusative Verbs 1
description: Is the sentence correct or wrong? For correct sentences, write -. For wrong sentences, write the correct version. All sentences are past simple.

title: Even
description: Change the sentences so that they include 'even'.

title: Ever and Never Exercise 1
description: Put in 'ever' or 'never'

title: First Conditional Form
description: Make the first conditional

title: First / second / third conditionals
description: Make the first, second or third conditional

title: Future Continuous Positive
description: Make the future continuous

title: Future Continuous Negative
description: Make the future continuous negative

title: Future Continuous Questions
description: Make future continuous questions

description: Make the future perfect continuous positive

title: Future Perfect Continuous Negative
description: Make the future perfect continuous negative form

title: Future Perfect Continuous Questions
description: Make the future perfect continuous question form

title: Future Perfect Continuous Mixed Exercise
description: Make the future perfect continuous. Choose the positive, negative or question form.

title: Future Perfect Positive
description: Make the future perfect positive

title: Future Perfect Negative
description: Make the future perfect negative

title: Future Perfect Questions
description: Make future perfect questions

title: Future Perfect Mixed Exercise
description: Make the future perfect

title: Future All Tenses
description: Make the correct tense.

title: Gerunds and Infinitives 1
description: Put the verb into either the gerund (-ing) or the infinitive (with 'to'):

title: Gerunds and Infinitives 2
description: Put the verb into the gerund or the infinitive:

title: Gerunds and Infinitives 3
description: Put the verb into the gerund or the infinitive

title: Gerunds and Infinitives 4
description: Put the verb into the gerund or the infinitive:

title: Indefinite Pronouns Exercise 1
description: Put in somebody / something / somewhere / anybody / anything / anywhere / nobody / nothing / nowhere / everybody / everything / everywhere.

title: Indirect Questions Exercise 1 (Present Simple Tense)
description: Change the direct questions into indirect questions. Use 'can you tell me'.

title: Indirect Questions Exercise 2 (Past Simple Tense)
description: Change the direct questions into indirect questions. Use 'do you know'.

title: Indirect Questions Exercise 3 (Modal Verbs)
description: Change the direct questions into indirect questions. Use 'could you tell me'.

title: Infinitives of Purpose Exercise 1
description: Change these sentences so that they have an infinitive of purpose (to + infinitive)

title: Inversion 1
description: Change the normal sentence into one with inversion. For example: "We had hardly arrived when Julie burst into the house" becomes "Hardly had we arrived when Julie burst into the house".

title: Irregular Verbs - Past Simple 1
description: Change the verb into the past simple

title: Irregular Verbs - Past Simple 2
description: Make the past simple

title: Irregular Verbs - Past Participle 1
description: Make the past participle

title: It and There
description: Choose 'it' or 'there'.

title: Let or Make 1
description: Put in 'let' or 'make' in the correct form.

title: Linking Words Contrast 1
description: Choose 'despite', 'however' or 'although'.

title: Linking Words Reason 1
description: Choose the correct word or phrase to fill the space.

title: Make or Do 1
description: Put in the correct form of 'make' or 'do'

title: Make or Do 2
description: Put in the correct form of 'make' or 'do'

title: Make or Do 3
description: Put in the correct form of 'make' or 'do'

title: Make or Do 4
description: Put in the correct form of 'make' or 'do':

title: Modals of Ability 1
description: Put in 'can', 'can't', 'could' or 'couldn't'. If none of these is possible use 'be able to' in the correct tense.

title: Modals of Obligation 1
description: Put in 'mustn't' or 'don't / doesn't have to'

title: Modals of Probability 1
description: Put in 'must + infinitive' or 'must + have + past participle':

title: Modals of Probability 2
description: put in 'must' or 'can't'

title: No and Not Exercise 1
description: Put in 'no' or 'not'

title: No or Not Exercise 2
description: Put in 'no' or 'not'

title: Nouns Exercise 1
description: Write down the nouns from the sentences.

title: Common or Proper Nouns 1
description: Are these nouns common nouns or proper nouns? Write 'common' or 'proper' in the box.

title: Countable or Uncountable Nouns 1
description: Are these nouns usually countable or uncountable? Write 'countable' or 'uncountable' in the box.

title: Participle Adjectives 1
description: Choose the correct adjective:

title: Participle Adjectives 2
description: Choose the correct adjective:

title: Participle Clauses 1
description: Make a reduced relative clause. These sentences all need an active clause.

title: Participle Clauses 2
description: Make a reduced relative clause. These sentences all need a passive clause.

title: Passive 1 (present simple)
description: Make these active present simple sentences passive. You don't need to repeat 'somebody'.

title: Passive 2 (past simple)
description: Make the passive form with the past simple. You don't need to repeat 'somebody'.

title: Passive 3 (present perfect)
description: Make these present perfect sentences passive. You don't need to repeat 'somebody'.

title: Passive 4 (future simple)
description: Change these future simple sentences into the passive. You don't need to repeat 'somebody'.

title: Passive 5 (mixed tenses)
description: Change these active sentences to passive.  Choose if you need the agent or not.

title: Passive with subordinate clauses
description: Make the subordinate clauses passive.

title: Passive 6 (two objects)
description: Change the active sentence into the passive. There are two answers for each question.

title: Relative Clauses 1
description: Add the phrase in brackets to the sentence using 'that' or 'who' and a relative clause:

title: Relative Clauses 2
description: Add the phrase in brackets to the sentence using a relative clause. Use 'that' or no pronoun:

title: Relative Clauses 3
description: Add the phrase in brackets to the sentence using a relative clause. If it's possible, you should drop the relative pronoun:

title: Relative Clauses 4
description: Add the phrase in brackets to the sentence using a relative clause. If it's possible, you should drop the relative pronoun:

title: Reported Statements 1
description: Change the direct speech into reported speech. Use 'she said' at the beginning of each answer. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Statements 4 (Present Continuous)
description: Make the direct speech into reported speech. Use 'he told me' at the beginning of your answer. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Statements 5 (Present Perfect)
description: Make reported speech from the direct speech. Use 'she said' at the beginning of each. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Statements 6 (Present Simple)
description: Change the direct speech into reported speech. Use 'she said' at the beginning of each answer. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Questions 1
description: Make reported questions.  Use 'she asked me' at the beginning of each answer. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Requests and Orders 1
description: Make reported requests or orders. Start each sentence with 'she asked me' or 'she told me'. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Speech Mixed Exercise 1
description: Make reported speech. Start all your answers with 'she', and use the past simple of 'ask', 'say' or 'tell'. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Speech Mixed Exercise 2
description: Make reported speech. Start all your answers with 'she', and use the past simple of 'ask', 'say' or 'tell'. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Speech Questions 2 (Wh questions)
description: Make reported questions. Start your answer with 'she asked me'. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Speech Questions 3 (Yes/No Questions)
description: Make reported questions. Start each answer with 'she asked me'. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Statements 2 (Future Simple)
description: Make reported statements. Start each sentence with 'she said' (don't use 'that'). It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reported Statements 3 (Past Simple)
description: Make reported statements. Remember, with the past simple you can change to the past perfect or keep to the past simple. In this exercise you should change to the past perfect. Start each sentence with 'he told me'. It's the same day, so you don't need to change the time expressions.

title: Reporting Verbs 1
description: Make a new sentence with the same meaning using the reporting verb in brackets.

title: Say and Tell Exercise 1
description: Put in 'said' or 'told'

title: Second Conditional Form
description: Make the second conditional

title: Future Simple Positive
description: Make the future simple

title: Future Simple Negative
description: Make the future simple

description: Make the future simple

title: So and Such Exercise 1
description: Put in 'so' or 'such'

title: So and Such Exercise 2
description: Put in 'so' or 'such'

title: So do I Exercise 1
description: Imagine you're having a conversation with Jenny. What she says is also true for you. Write 'so --- I' or 'neither ---I', choosing the correct auxiliary verb.

title: Some and Any Exercise 1
description: Choose 'some' or 'no article'. If you need 'no article', put -.

title: Some and Any Exercise 2
description: Choose 'some' or 'any':

title: Stative Verbs 1
description: Choose the present simple or present continuous. This exercise includes the verbs see, think, have, be, and taste, which are sometimes stative.

title: Subject and Object Pronouns Exercise 1
description: Choose the correct pronoun.

title: Subject and Object Questions 1
description: Make object or subject questions.

title: Subjects and Objects 1
description: Write the subject or the object in the box

title: Superlatives with 'the' 1
description: Fill the gap with 'the' if it's necessary. If you can choose either, then use 'no article' (-).

title: Superlatives with 'the' 2
description: If it's possible to choose between 'the' and 'no article', put 'the'. Otherwise, put 'no article' (-).

title: There is / there are
description: Change these (strange!) sentences so that you use 'there + the correct tenses of be'

title: Third Conditional Form
description: Make the third conditional

title: This That These Those Exercise 1
description: Choose this or that or these or those.

title: Prepositions of Time 1
description: Put in the correct preposition (choose in / on / at). If no preposition is needed put in -.

title: Prepositions of Time 2
description: Put in the correct preposition (choose in / on / at). If no preposition is needed put in -.

title: Used to Exercise 1
description: Make an affirmative sentence, negative sentence or question using 'used to + infinitive':

title: Used to Exercise 2
description: If it's possible, make a sentence with 'would + infinitive'. If it's not possible, use 'used to + infinitive':

title: Be Used To Exercise 1
description: Make sentences using 'be used to + verb-ing' or 'be used to + noun / pronoun'. You need to choose the correct tense:

title: Prepositions after Verbs 1
description: Put in the correct preposition

title: Prepositions after Verbs 2
description: Put in the correct preposition

title: Wish Exercise 1
description: I wish things were different! Make sentences using 'wish' + past simple about the things I don't like. You can put in 'that' if you want, or leave it out.

title: Zero Conditional Form
description: Make the zero conditional
